Description: Lower body sherd and ring foot of East Greek pottery cup or bowl; interior: wall glazed with two added red bands, probably lined in white; tondo reserved with large floral pattern of buds and palmettes; exterior reserved with three black bands below handle zone and another on lower wall and outside of foot; underside reserved; inscription on underside.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, no. 358)
Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (East Greek 172)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.154)
